definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: It is necessary and appropriate that the interest should he listed into the standard system of the text compiling.
sentences.chinese: 將趣味性列入課文編選的標準體系是必要的和適宜的。

sentences.english: Collections of Roaring Songs is a collection of poems edited by Mr.
sentences.chinese: 《嘯歌集》是作者生前編選的詩歌結集。

sentences.english: She has edited the media studies quarterly, Screen.
sentences.chinese: 她編選了這本媒體研究季刊&《銀幕》。

sentences.english: The style of DU's poems differed from the opinions of the compiler and from the major opinions of poetry aesthetic at that time.
sentences.chinese: 杜詩風格與編選者的主張及當時詩歌審美的主流相悖。

sentences.english: An edited transcript of the interview follows.
sentences.chinese: 以下是編選的採訪對話。

definition: to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
form of writing novels that comprise lots of poetry in the body of the text, popular in the Ming Dynasty
to comment/a point by point commentary
